content: Hi, I just filed https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-dev-guide/pull/1279 to start streamlining "Getting Started".

This was inspired by me trying to understand (yet again) the bootstrapping structure, and I noticed just how much duplicated info there is about it across "Getting Started", "How to Build and Run the Compiler", "The compiler testing framework", "Bootstrapping the Compiler".

This PR doesn't even touch on that, it just streamlines stuff relating to cloning, configuration, and prereqs, as a starter. If people like what I've done, I can do more about building/testing/etc. later on

FYI, I am working on a reorganizing and expanding the tests chapter. Let me know if there is something you'd like to see changed or added. I'm not sure if you had specific examples of duplication that seems out of place.

I think by the nature of a large piece of documentation like the rustc-dev-guide, there's going to be some duplication. Some chapters are written for specific use cases like "I want to do X...", and others are more reference material ("here's how to run x.py"). Different chapters for different audiences might have some overlap.
I skimmed your PR and it looks good to me.
I agree some overlap is fine. But if the "Getting Started" chapter has as much detail on topic X as the chapter about topic X... :smile:
